result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew C. Sherman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Must seek and maintain full-time employment, full-time higher education, or a combination thereof satisfactory to probation agent.  Must obtain GED or HSED.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Must not associate with any known illegal drug users or dealers, nor drug houses.  No contact with victim, R. C. unless approved by your agent.  Only incidental contact allowed for hearings to be held in Rock County regarding paternity.

Defendant must find housing acceptable to your probation agent.  Must participate in Batterer Intervention Progamming or DV Court whichever your agent deems appropriate.  Must comply with any other recommendations by your agent for treatment, counseling, or programming.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Jackson County Case No. 13CF110.

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  DNA surcharge not ordered.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.  Pay the costs of supervision.

Obtain and maintain full time employment or a combination of employment and education that is the equivalent of being occupied full time.  Occupation to be approved by his agent.  Not to voluntarily terminate employment without agent's prior approval.  

Obtain housing that meets with agent's approval.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant  shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means with the victim or her residence.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to associate with any known drug dealers or any known drug users or their residences.  Not to be present any any place where controlled substances are used or are illegally sold.  Defendant to completely sever all ties to the drug sub-culture.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Defendant to obey all rules and conditions established by the Department of Corrections.  Comply with risk and needs assessments and any other screening tools identified by the Department of Corrections.  Comply with case plan goals related to identified criminogenic needs and follow throught with all programming recommended by the Departments of Corrections.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: same as prision sentence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

of 8/7/15 SEHR hearing

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Fredrickson.  State recommended 4 years total.  24 Mo. IC and 24 Mo. ES.  Consecutive to 13CF110. 

Defense agrees with recommendation, except requests the sentences run concurrent.  Defendant elects to exercise his right to allocution.  

Court ordered:  Total sentence:  4 yr.   24 mo. IC, 24 mo  ES.  Eligible for  CIP & SAR  Consecutive to 13CF110.    Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: the victim.  Obey all other rules.  AODA.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Sever all ties to drug culture.  Obtain and maintain employment, and housing approved by agent.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. CC & supervision.  No DNA surcharge.  Submit sample.
